items.title: Sustainable Design Hackathon
items.description: Awarded 3rd place in an intensive 2-day hackathon focused on sustainable innovation. Expanded the 'GuardianX' project into a comprehensive multi-app ecosystem, developing a dedicated mobile application during the competition. The project received high praise from the jury for its technical execution and innovative approach to pest detection. Despite facing highly experienced competitors, secured a top-three finish and a 1000 AZN cash prize.

items.title: Startup School 3 & Green and Digital Silk Road
items.organization: Center for Analysis of Economic Reforms and Communication & Enterprise Azerbaijan
items.description: Selected as a finalist for the 'Demo Day' in the 'Startup School 3' project, part of the 'Green and Digital Silk Road' international acceleration program. Developed the 'GuardianX' MVP from scratch, including a mobile application and a comprehensive web platform focused on AI-driven pest detection. Completed 45 hours of intensive online training led by local and international mentors, gaining expertise in product scaling, market entry, and technical roadmaps. Received specialized mentorship from Alperen Zeki Gokmen to refine the business model and pitch strategy for presentation to potential investors and business leaders.

items.title: Middle Mobile & Backend Developer
items.description:
Led the end-to-end development of 3 production-level applications over 1 year and 10 months, evolving from initial exploration to implementing advanced modular architectures.

Key Technical Contributions:

* **Mobile Mastery (Flutter & Riverpod):** Architected apps using Clean Architecture and Modular patterns. Implemented a robust data strategy combining State Management + Repository Pattern + Cache + Local Database (Hive/SQFLite) + REST API integration.

* **Advanced Backend (Django & AI):** Developed complex backend systems with a focus on automation. Integrated OpenAI’s Whisper AI for voice processing, utilized Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) for models, and implemented Table Inheritance for optimized database structures.

* **Cloud & DevOps:** Executed seamless integrations with Cloud providers and Firebase services (Cloud Messaging, Analytics, Authentication). Managed the full release cycle, including handling Apple-specific requirements like APNs notifications and App Store deployment.

* **UI/UX Excellence:** Created custom animation engines and focused on high-fidelity design implementation, ensuring a premium user experience across all 3 production apps.

* **Evolution of Expertise:** Successfully transitioned from legacy development practices to modern, scalable software engineering standards, ensuring high performance and code maintainability.

items.title: Virtual Internship Program (VTP’9 NANO)
items.description: Participated in an intensive virtual internship program focusing on enterprise IT infrastructure and modern development workflows. Gained hands-on experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems. Mastered No-Code development platforms to streamline business processes and focused on professional Web Design, including Responsive Web Design (RWD) and Frontend development. Successfully completed various corporate IT tasks, ensuring high-quality standards in project deliverables.

items.title: Academic Recommendation: Software Engineering
items.organization: French-Azerbaijani University (UFAZ) / Federal University of Uberlândia (UFU)
items.description: Professional academic recommendation from Prof. Igor S. Peretta, PhD. The endorsement highlights a perfect score of 100/100 in the Software Engineering course (2025), a rare achievement attained through exceptional mastery of software lifecycle, architecture, and design principles. This result significantly contributed to a stellar 98% GPA in 2024, ranking me at the very top of the Computer Science program. The professor emphasizes advanced analytical skills and the ability to grasp complex engineering topics with precision.

media.title: Recommendation Letter - Prof. Igor S. Peretta

items.title: University Transcripts (L0-L2)
items.description: Comprehensive academic transcripts for Bachelor of Computer Science. Key highlights include a perfect score (20/20) in Software Engineering and exceptional performance in core CS subjects such as Data Structures and Algorithms (18.275/20), Cryptography (18.675/20), and Mathematics (consistently high scores across Analysis and Algebra). Maintained 'Admis' (Pass) status across all semesters with a strong progression in technical proficiency and analytical reasoning.

items.title: Coursera
items.description: Selected as a participant in Azerbaijan’s national '4Sİ Akademiyası' (Fourth Industrial Revolution Academy) initiative—a joint project by the Center for Analysis and Coordination of the Fourth Industrial Revolution (4Sİ) under the Ministry of Economy, the Education Development Fund, and Coursera. Awarded full scholarship access to the global platform. Successfully completed the professional certification course authorized by Stanford University and DeepLearning.AI, taught by industry pioneer Andrew Ng. The curriculum covered core Machine Learning concepts, including linear regression, logistic regression, and model optimization techniques.

media.title: Coursera Supervised Machine Learning Certificate
media.path: fixed_data/academic/courses/coursera/Coursera Supervised Machine Learning Regression and Classification.pdf

items.title: Advanced Computer Science Courses
items.description: Completed intensive Advanced Computer Science programs focusing on high-level competitive programming and algorithmic mathematics. The curriculum covered advanced topics such as Dynamic Programming (DP), Suffix Array, and complex data structures including Trie, Treap, Implicit Treap, and Palindromic Tree. Gained deep expertise in Graph Theory (Bipartite Matching, Maximum Flow, Min-Cost Max-Flow), Computational Geometry (Convex Hull Trick), Number Theory, Sqrt Decomposition, and Triple Search. Explored Advanced Game Theory and sophisticated search algorithms. In Phase I (at ADA University), ranked 5th out of 100+ participants; in Phase II, maintained high engagement with a Progress Certificate.

items.title: Udemy: Udemy
items.description: Comprehensive software engineering track focusing on mobile development, system design, and backend excellence. Course 1: Flutter & Dart (Maximilian Schwarzmüller) - Full SDK mastery and native integration. Course 2: Advanced Flutter (Kanan Yusubov) - Clean Architecture, SOLID, and Monorepo management. Course 3: Software Architecture (Andrii Sviatobatko) - Structural patterns and system scaling. Course 4: Java Technical Interview (Andrii Piatakha) - Core Java internals and Spring Framework deep-dive.

items.title: Advanced Backend Programming with Java
items.organization: Mentorship by Ilkin Mehdiyev (Senior Software Engineer)
items.description: Selected for an exclusive, 9-month intensive mentorship program focused on professional backend engineering. Under the guidance of Senior Engineer Ilkin Mehdiyev, mastered Java Fundamentals and Advanced Java programming. The program specialized in Spring Boot development, covering industry-standard practices for building robust and scalable APIs. Emphasized clean code principles, effective backend architecture, and real-world problem-solving. Participated in high-level technical discussions and collaborative learning within a select group of high-potential developers.

items.title: Codestar: Advanced Programming Fast-Track
items.description: Achieved an exceptional milestone by completing a comprehensive 6-month Fundamentals of Programming and Advanced Algorithms course in just 1 month. This record-breaking fast-track completion demonstrates extraordinary learning speed and mastery of core concepts. The curriculum focused on C++ Mastery, Advanced Data Structures, and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP). Successfully applied Design Patterns and Competitive Programming techniques to solve complex algorithmic challenges, finishing significantly ahead of schedule with top-tier performance.

items.title: ABB Math Challenge
items.description: Selected as a winner of the ABB Math Challenge to participate in an intensive 10-day Olympiad Mathematics training program conducted by expert instructors from Russia. The curriculum involved a deep dive into advanced mathematical and algorithmic disciplines, including Game Theory, Graph Theory, and Number Theory. Mastered complex concepts in Probability, Computational Geometry, and advanced Algorithm design. The program was characterized by rigorous seminars and daily competitive assessments, focusing on high-level mathematical logic and sophisticated problem-solving techniques, contributing to a high-ranking performance in final evaluations.

items.title: Limitless Mathematicians Program
items.description: Selected for the prestigious 'Limitless Mathematicians' program at ADA University for two consecutive years. In the first year, mastered Geometry, Number Theory, and Advanced Algorithms under the mentorship of Prof. Yagub Aliyev, securing 3rd place in the final evaluations. In the second year, expanded expertise into Cryptography and Probability, guided by a team of ADA professors including Samir and Rafael alongside Prof. Aliyev, achieving an improved ranking of 2nd place. The program focused on high-level mathematical reasoning, complex problem-solving, and the application of abstract theories to computational challenges.

items.title: Testdome
items.description: Successfully earned a PHP certification from Testdome, demonstrating proficiency in back-end development and problem-solving. Achieved a ranking in the Top 25% of all test-takers, validating strong skills in server-side logic, data handling, and efficient coding practices.

items.title: Oracle
items.description: Currently pursuing professional certification in MySQL through Oracle's academic path. Completed initial attempts for the MySQL Implementation Associate exam, scoring 54/100 (Passing Score: 60/100), and the MySQL 8.0 Database Administrator exam, scoring 20/100 (Passing Score: 62/100). Actively reinforcing technical expertise in database management and architecture in preparation for the upcoming retakes.

items.title: HackerRank Certiffications
items.description: A collection of HackerRank Skill Certifications validating fundamental proficiency in software development. These credentials verify core competencies in Problem Solving (Data Structures and Algorithms), alongside technical mastery in Java, C#, and JavaScript. Each certification was earned by passing rigorous skill assessments designed to evaluate logical reasoning and language-specific best practices.

items.title: Turkcell
items.description: Completed a comprehensive web development curriculum through Turkcell’s 'Geleceği Yazanlar' initiative. Successfully mastered foundational and intermediate concepts across the Web Programming 101 and 201 series, covering the essential building blocks of modern web technologies, front-end architecture, and development workflows.

items.title: ICPC Azerbaijan Qualification 2026
items.organization: ICPC Foundation / Azerbaijan Higher Education Institutions
items.description: Participated in the Azerbaijan Qualification round of the 2026 International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC). Recognized with an 'Honorable Mention' for successful problem-solving performance in a highly competitive national field. Continued to demonstrate consistent participation and technical skill in algorithmic challenges, maintaining a strong presence in the competitive programming community.

items.title: International Computer Science Competition 2025
items.description: Successfully participated in the Qualification Round of the 2025 International Computer Science Competition. Received special honor for submitting high-quality code that passed all evaluated test cases. Based on performance in the qualification, advanced to the Pre-Final Round 2025 as a qualified participant. The competition is a prestigious global extracurricular science challenge for high school and university students, focusing on rigorous algorithmic problem solving.

items.title: Sumgait Cup – Programming Camp
items.organization: IDDA, ARTI, Sumgait State University & ICPC Azerbaijan
items.description: Actively participated in the 'Sumgait Cup – Programming Camp,' an intensive competitive programming event organized by the Innovation and Digital Development Agency (IDDA), the Institute of Education (ARTI), and Sumgait State University. The camp, supported by the ICPC Azerbaijan Regional Contest, focused on advanced algorithmic problem solving, efficient data structure implementation, and collaborative coding practices in C++.

items.title: Pigma Quiz Competition
items.description: Served as the Chief of Staff for the UFAZ Math Club, leading the organizational efforts for the 'Pigma Quiz Competition.' Contributed to the competition's academic integrity by co-authoring the mathematical challenge questions and acted as a formal proctor during the event. Managed operational logistics and coordination between stakeholders to ensure a successful competitive environment.

items.title: Data Science and AI Engineering Mini Bootcamps
items.description: Completed a series of intensive 8-hour Machine Learning bootcamps focused on the end-to-end data science lifecycle. The curriculum integrated Python programming for data science, statistical analysis, feature engineering, and machine learning model development. Additionally, explored Generative AI applications and practical implementations in engineering contexts.

items.title: ICPC Azerbaijan Qualification 2025
items.organization: ICPC Foundation / Azerbaijan Higher Education Institutions
items.description: Demonstrated significant competitive growth by ranking 18th in the Azerbaijan Qualification round of the International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC). Awarded the 'Second Award' for high-level algorithmic problem-solving and efficiency. This performance represents a major leap from previous standings, showcasing advanced proficiency in C++, complex data structures, and optimized algorithm design under high-pressure competitive environments.

items.title: ICPC Azerbaijan Regional Contest 2025
items.organization: ICPC Foundation / Azerbaijan Higher Education Institutions
items.description: Achieved a standout performance at the ICPC Azerbaijan Regional (Republican) Championship, competing against the nation's elite university teams. Earned a 'Third Award' for exceptional algorithmic problem-solving and efficiency in a high-stakes competitive environment. Recognized with an 'Honorable Mention' for technical excellence. The contest required solving complex challenges involving advanced data structures, dynamic programming, and sophisticated graph algorithms under intense time pressure.

items.title: AEGEE Youth Forum
items.description: Participated in the 'AEGEE Youth Forum,' a multidisciplinary event focused on the integration of emerging technologies and professional growth. The forum covered key contemporary fields including Cybersecurity, Data Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence (AI). Additionally, engaged in sessions dedicated to Personal and Career Development, gaining insights into the evolving job market and tech landscape.

items.title: MathCamp 2024 Student Spring Camp
items.organization: Ministry of Science and Education of Azerbaijan & 'Bir Könüllü' Student Cooperation Public Union
items.description: Successfully participated in 'MathCamp 2024,' a student spring camp held in the Guba region. The program, supported by the Ministry of Science and Education, focused on intensive mathematical problem-solving and collaboration among high-achieving students. Gained practical insights into complex mathematical theories and logic through team-based activities and academic seminars.

items.title: Bu bizə harda lazım olacaq?
items.organization: BHOS Math Club (Baku Higher Oil School)
items.description: Awarded 3rd place in the mathematics competition titled 'Bu bizə harda lazım olacaq?' (Where will we need this?), organized by the Baku Higher Oil School (BHOS) Mathematics Club. The competition tested students' ability to apply theoretical mathematical concepts to practical, real-world scenarios and complex problem-solving challenges.

items.title: WorldSkills Azerbaijan: Web Technologies
items.description: Qualified for the Republican (National) round of WorldSkills Azerbaijan in Web Technologies. Over a high-intensity 2-day period, successfully executed complex full-stack development tasks, including UI/UX design (Photoshop), frontend development (HTML/CSS/JS/React), and backend logic. Handled challenging real-world projects and rigorous technical requirements, demonstrating speed, precision, and comprehensive technical expertise under competitive pressure.

items.title: ICPC Azerbaijan Qualification 2024
items.organization: ICPC Foundation / Azerbaijan Higher Education Institutions
items.description: Competed in the Azerbaijan Qualification round of the International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC), the premier global competitive programming competition. Ranked 67th overall in a highly competitive field of university-level problem solvers. Awarded the 'High Achievement' medal for exceptional performance in solving complex algorithmic challenges under strict time constraints. Demonstrated mastery in advanced data structures, graph theory, and dynamic programming using C++.

items.title: Resolving Interclass Similarities in Sign Language Using Adaptive Loss Function
items.description: Co-authored and presented peer-reviewed research at the Young Researchers Conference on Artificial Intelligence & Big Data, hosted by ADA University. The study introduces an 'Adaptive Loss Function' to mitigate interclass similarities in Sign Language Recognition. By dynamically penalizing confusing sign pairs, the model achieved a 23.5% reduction in Word Error Rate (WER) and increased accuracy for similar signs by 18%. This teacher-student collaboration, supported by UFAZ and sponsored by Neurotime, focuses on advancing digital accessibility in Azerbaijan through deep learning and multi-modal computer vision.

items.title: III Student Republic Scientific-Practical Conference
items.organization: Ministry of Science and Education of Azerbaijan & Various Institutes
items.description: Awarded 1st place at the III Student Republic Scientific-Practical Conference dedicated to the 100th anniversary of National Leader Heydar Aliyev. Conducted extensive research on 'Modular Arithmetic and Remainder Division,' advocating for its earlier introduction in the national secondary education curriculum. Argued that modular arithmetic, currently primarily taught at the university level in Azerbaijan, is essential for developing logical reasoning from lower grades. The research was supported by the R.H.F.G. named after S.C. Pishavari and several academic institutes.
